item.description:
Salt marshes, upland forest, big bridges, river islands, cool swimming, and ... Cliff Diving!! for those who dare!

Spend an interesting afternoon paddling the historic and commercially important Merrimac River. We'll begin in Newburyport amid shiny white fiberglass pleasure boats.  But after crossing the river, we'll enter a quiet, bird-filled salt marsh.  After that, there are forests to explore, rocks to climb, and a couple of great swimming and diving spots to enjoy.

We can make the paddle last as long as we want but figure on 3-4 hours including swim/rest time.

-Those interested in carpooling, please let us know what town you're coming from in your RSVP comments.

Bring a change of clothes and we'll go out to eat in Newburyport after the paddle.

Special thanks to George Pardi for his planning assistance.

*One rental kayak available. Contact Larry for details.* 

High Tide: 4:40pm

Liability Release
AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing.  Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning.  -Larry Pilla
item.name: Kayak the Merrimac-yak-yak-yak!!
